Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2007 04:27PM Abby2 wrote: I am also scheduled for surgery soon.  One thing I just learned from my surgeon (Dr. Howard Wang, San Antonio, TX) is that he uses the ON-Q Pain Buster, which is a soaker catheter placed in the incision which delivers lidocaine (or another numbing agent) to the wound for the 1st few days after surgery.  It is supposed to alleviate some of the need for narcotics and enable women to get out of bed & ambulating sooner.  Maybe someone else has had experience with this and could tell you more, but I was happy to hear about it and look forward to less pain after my reconstruction surgery (DIEP) in November.  Best of Luck, Abby2
